message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.DS 

This paper is about training convolutional neural networks (CNNs), which is a topic that falls under the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG), computer vision (cs.CV), neural networks (cs.NE), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and data structures (cs.DS). Given that the paper focuses on a specific technique for reducing the memory cost of training CNNs, it is most likely to be classified under cs.LG and cs.CV, which are the two most relevant sub-categories for machine learning and computer vision research. However, it could also be classified under cs.NE and cs.AI, which are broader categories that encompass neural networks and artificial intelligence research. Finally, the paper may touch on data structures and algorithms for efficient memory management, which could place it under cs.DS as well.
